title: Degradation of <italic>Gadd45</italic> mRNA by nonsense-mediated decay is essential for viability
abstract: The nonsense-mediated mRNA decay (NMD) pathway functions to degrade both abnormal and wild-type mRNAs. NMD is essential for viability in most organisms, but the molecular basis for this requirement is unknown. Here we show that a single, conserved NMD target, the mRNA coding for the stress response factor growth arrest and DNA-damage inducible 45 (GADD45) can account for lethality in <italic>Drosophila</italic> lacking core NMD genes. Moreover, depletion of <italic>Gadd45</italic> in mammalian cells rescues the cell survival defects associated with NMD knockdown. Our findings demonstrate that degradation of <italic>Gadd45</italic> mRNA is the essential NMD function and, surprisingly, that the surveillance of abnormal mRNAs by this pathway is not necessarily required for viability.
